item.title: Pi 317 [Item Count]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

public int getCount(int item) {
    int count = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < items.length; i++) {
        if (items[i] == item) {
            count += amount[i];
        }
    }
}

Or something similar

item.title: Pi 317 [Item Count]
item.dc:creator: @BLEBLABLE BLEBLABLE
item.description:
@BLEBLABLE wrote:

} else if (c.dialogueAction == 14) {
   c.getItems().deleteItem(item1,itemAmount1);
   c.getItems().deleteItem(item2,itemAmount2);
   c.getItems().deleteItem(item3,itemAmount3);
   varMoney = ((itemAmount1 * 50000) + (itemAmount2 * 75000) + (itemAmount3 * 95000));
   c.getItems().addItem(995,varMoney);
}

I want it to record how much logs the player has in his inventory,and deleteAll of those items, then replace it with the log amount * Gold Points.

logs = item1,2,3
Amount of logs in Inventory = ItemAmount1,2,3 (each log has different variable (1,2,3))
log amount = itemAmount1 * 50k + log amount2 = itemAmount2 * 75k + log amount3 = itemAmount3 * 95k = replaced item ( GOLD POINTS)
what can i do to make it record the itemAmount variables? Thanks!
